@mkobach Reply with something you’re currently reading, watching, and listening to. Here’s mine:

How to Be an Antiracist + A Court of Thorns and Roses 

Watching:
Community (3x)

Listening:
What a Day Podcast

RT @CASatUSF: COMING UP: 

@DrIbram will discuss his best-selling book “How to Be an Antiracist”, sharing new ways of thinking about race,…

1: Thank you NCSEA for a great discussion with @DrIbram , the author of How to Be an Antiracist.

One of many takeaways from our conversation around our collective work to address equity through the lens of anti-racism in our public schools.

#EdJustice https://t.co/36BLg1Cbva

@NicolasEdny I did not know this and just....back to my reading (currently How To Be An Antiracist after finishing White Fragility) because we WP (esp women) have a lot of work to do. https://t.co/o0Y64jbUxt

“How to be an Antiracist,” the book by historian Ibram Kendi, did not see widespread readership until the summer of 2020, a time the nation was undergoing a reckoning regarding racism occurring within its own institutions and policies. https://t.co/7KgdUUtH61
RT @MLuckritz: “Every institution needs to assess impact of practices & policies.”          -@DrIbram author of How to be an Antiracist…

data.text: Listening to Natalie Moore and @DrIbram talk about how to be an Antiracist sponsored by a conglomeration of libraries. Every time I listen to @DrIbram, I learn more about how I can be Antiracist. It’s been a personal journey. And I’m so grateful for the guidance. https://t.co/ai8vf2FLwI

In his book, "How to Be An Antiracist," Dr. Ibram X. Kendi outlines the difference between being "not racist" and being actively antiracist, which is an act of taking steps to work against racist ideals and practices. 

In what ways are you taking steps to be an antiracist? https://t.co/6gGMnTdJfS

Thank you to The Beryl Institute for a wonderful interview!

Listen for my tips on how to be an Antiracist in Healthcare! https://t.co/dpKcv2CyM1

data.text: @KilclooneyJohn @williamcrawley John. Please. It’s time to say sorry and delete your racist tweet, and maybe take a Twitter vacation. While you’re doing so maybe read: How To Be an Antiracist https://t.co/CINxmWZ2Dy

@montgomerycoll @DrPollard_MC facilitates Strategic Horizon Network with @DrIbram on book How to Be an Antiracist, powerful tool to confront racial inequity head-on. One takeaway: “Institutions must collect racial data beyond racial makeup. Look at hiring, promotion, retention.”

entity.description: Olivia Pope, a former media relations consultant to the president, is ready to move on with her life and opens her own crisis-management firm, but she can't seem to shake ties with her past. Pope's staff includes womaniser-turned-family man Stephen Finch, slick litigator Harrison Wright and hacker extraordinaire Huck. As she moves forward it becomes clear that while her staffers may specialise in cleaning up the lives of other people, they can't seem to do the same for themselves.
entity.name: Scandal

data.text: Your apology was a PR spin that Olivia Pope would of initiated. If you verbalize those elitist, racially divisive remarks on National TV then we can only imagine what you say in private. Ibram X. Kendi’s book “How to Be an Antiracist” Read and learn Eva! @EvaLongoria
RT @creighton_SCSJ: Students, faculty, staff and alumni are invited to read "How to Be an Antiracist" and join our 4 virtual discussion gro…

To grow up in America, racist ideas are constantly being rained upon your head, and you have no umbrella, and you don’t even know you’re wet with those racist ideas – because the racist ideas themselves cause you to imagine you’re dry. @DrIbram @BreneBrown https://t.co/We1zsny4WC

Buy, or Download, and Read : (In no particular order)

3/5
Ibram X Kendi -- "How To Be An AntiRacist" https://t.co/RnljBBuLI6

data.text: If you don’t think you need to read this book, you probably need to read this book. I’m listening to it on audiobook while knitting a sweater. https://t.co/4Q8cpgKBUa

@Teacher5Mr @emnode .@emnode you can like the above all you want, but you have yet to explain how antiracism is racism. You’ve tried on and off for weeks in my DMs and publicly. Our convo ended with you agreeing to *actually* How To Be An Antiracist. This would be funny if it weren’t so nonsensical.

@JohnathanPerk @emnode The only remedy to  racist discrimination is  antiracist discrimination. The only remedy to past discrimination is present discrimination. The  only  remedy to  present discrimination is future discrimination. - Ibram X Kendi, "How to be an Antiracist"
Starting How to Be an Antiracist, by Ibram X. Kendi https://t.co/VGy3QynnTw

@JohnathanPerk @DrIbram X "How To Be An Antiracist" Kendi himself says antiracism demands discrimination on the basis of race. What definition of "racism" are you using where "discrimination on the basis of race" isn't racist? https://t.co/Cd1NZjdkjT
